text: John Joseph Manning (11 December 1940 â€“ 17 February 2021) was an English footballer. He played as forward for many clubs between 1962 and 1976. Manning played for Tranmere Rovers, Shrewsbury Town, Norwich City, Bolton Wanderers, Walsall, Crewe Alexandra F.C., and Barnsley. Manning was born on 11 December 1940 in Liverpool, England. In later life, Manning suffered from Alzheimer's disease. His death was announced on 17 February 2021. ==References== Category:1940 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:English footballers Category:Sportspeople from Liverpool
title: John Manning (footballer)
